name: JetBrains ACP Agent Registry
description: A directory of AI coding agents integrated directly into JetBrains IDEs, allowing users to browse and connect external AI agents without manual setup. Launched in partnership with Zed as the 'LSP protocol for coding agents' enabling open interoperability.
community_quotes: Described as 'a very exquisite, compact protocol' that 'strictly follows MCP's Json-RPC specification'
Called the 'LSP protocol for Coding Agents' highlighting its decoupling and openness

name: 1Code
description: An open-source Cursor-like UI for Claude Code that allows running Claude Code agents in parallel. Available on Mac (runs locally with/without worktrees) and Web platforms, achieved #1 trending on Product Hunt with 579 points.
community_quotes: Achieved 402 upvotes and 39 comments on Product Hunt
Ranked #1 trending on Product Hunt for January 16, 2026

name: Blink Agent Builder
description: A full-stack agentic vibe coding platform that enables building AI applications from natural language prompts without code. Achieved #1 Product of the Day with 360 votes, supporting 180+ AI models with code execution, vector database integration, and tool calling capabilities.
community_quotes: The hard part with agents is not dreaming them up, it is gluing together tools, models and flows without losing a weekend. This solves that
Users appreciate being able to describe agents in plain English rather than manually connecting components

name: Nori CLI
description: A Rust-based CLI interface for AI coding agents (Claude, Gemini, Codex) with multi-agent support, parallel tool execution, and flicker-free interface. Marketed as 'the best coding agent CLI on the market' and an improved interface for Claude Code.
community_quotes: Described as 'a very thin and very fast TUI wrapper around multiple agent providers'
Built in Rust for speed with flicker-free interface

name: flins
description: A universal skill and command manager for AI coding agents that works across Claude Code, Cursor, GitHub Copilot, Windsurf, Gemini CLI and 15+ other tools. Provides CLI-based management (add, update, remove, list, search) treating agent skills like dependencies. Ranked #13 day rank with 87 upvotes.
community_quotes: Acts as a 'dependency manager for agent skills, similar to how npm works for JavaScript packages'
Solves managing AI agent skills consistently across multiple AI coding tools from a single interface

name: Coderrr
description: A free, open-source CLI-first AI coding companion that runs in the terminal. Assists with code generation, refactoring, bug explanation, debugging, and code analysis. Positioned as 'Like Claude Code, but free and open source' with 53 upvotes on Product Hunt.
community_quotes: Positioned as 'Like Claude Code, but free and open source'
Open source CLI-first AI coding companion for terminal-based development

name: yolo-cage
description: Security sandboxing tool that prevents AI coding agents from exfiltrating secrets or merging their own PRs, addressing 'YOLO mode' security concerns. Built to run in Kubernetes, scanning egress traffic for secrets while maintaining TOS compliance with Max subscription.
community_quotes: Tests are the core of the new agent engineering
Even if the cage code is AI-written and imperfect, it still creates a security barrier through defense in depth
Solves permission prompt fatigue when using multiple AI coding agents

name: Moshi
description: A mobile interface for AI coding agents that allows developers to run agents like Claude Code from iPhone. Features voice commands, persistent sessions, and Face ID security, addressing the problem that agents need frequent input but developers aren't always at their desks.
community_quotes: Agents need frequent input, but you can't always be at your desk
Extends AI coding agent functionality to mobile devices for remote monitoring and guidance

name: Reporails
description: A CLI linter designed specifically for AI coding agent instruction files (like CLAUDE.md), covering 42 rules across structure, content, efficiency, governance, and maintenance. Created to address issues where AI agents make changes 'different, not better' and actively seeking feedback and contributors.
community_quotes: Agents can generate code, get automatic feedback from linters, and self-learn/iterate until code is clean
The missing linter for AI instruction files with 42 rules covering multiple dimensions

name: Yolobox
description: A containerized environment that gives AI coding agents full sudo access and complete permissions to the development workspace, embracing the 'YOLO' philosophy of unrestricted AI agent access while protecting the user's home directory through container isolation.
community_quotes: An exciting experiment exploring what happens when an AI agent gets full access to a real development environment
Part of the trend of sandbox wrappers for secure AI agent containment
